name: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A classic coming-of-age novel following the experiences of a young man in New York City.
details: ISBN: 978-0316769488, Pages: 288, Publisher: Little, Brown and Company

name: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy adventure novel about a hobbit's quest to reclaim a treasure guarded by a dragon.

name: The Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: A bildungsroman novel following the life of an orphan named Pip, exploring themes of social class and redemption.

name: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
description: A magical realist novel chronicling the history of the Buendia family in the fictional town of Macondo.
details: ISBN: 978-0061120091, Pages: 417, Publisher: Harper Perennial Modern Classics

name: Lord of the Flies
author: William Golding
description: A novel depicting the descent into savagery of a group of boys stranded on a deserted island.

name: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel depicting a future society where people are engineered for conformity and pleasure.
details: ISBN: 978-0060850524, Pages: 288, Publisher: Harper Perennial Modern Classics

name: Dune Messiah
author: Frank Herbert
description: The second novel in the Dune series, continuing the epic saga of political intrigue and power struggles on the desert planet Arrakis.

name: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
description: A cyberpunk classic following the story of a washed-up computer hacker hired for one last job that blurs the lines between reality and cyberspace.

name: The Left Hand of Darkness
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
description: A groundbreaking work of science fiction exploring themes of gender and identity on the planet Gethen.

name: Snow Crash
author: Neal Stephenson
description: A high-octane cyberpunk novel featuring a computer hacker and a virtual reality metaverse, exploring the collision of technology and ancient Sumerian mythology.

name: Altered Carbon
author: Richard K. Morgan
description: A hardboiled cyberpunk novel set in a future where consciousness can be transferred between bodies, following a former soldier turned investigator.

name: Red Mars
author: Kim Stanley Robinson
description: The first book in the Mars Trilogy, exploring the colonization and terraforming of Mars, and the political and social challenges faced by the settlers.

name: The Girl on the Train
author: Paula Hawkins
description: A psychological thriller involving a woman who becomes embroiled in a missing person's investigation after witnessing something suspicious during her daily train commute.

name: Gone Baby Gone
author: Dennis Lehane
description: A gripping mystery involving private investigators searching for a missing child in a working-class neighborhood of Boston.

name: The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency
author: Alexander McCall Smith
description: The first book in a series featuring a Botswana detective agency run by the wise and compassionate Mma Precious Ramotswe.

name: The Cuckoo's Calling
author: Robert Galbraith (pseudonym for J.K. Rowling)
description: The first book in the Cormoran Strike series, where a private detective investigates the mysterious suicide of a supermodel.

name: The Hound of the Baskervilles
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
description: A classic Sherlock Holmes mystery novel, where Holmes and Watson investigate the legend of a supernatural hound haunting the Baskerville family.

name: Sharp Objects
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A psychological thriller featuring a troubled journalist returning to her hometown to cover the murder of two young girls, unraveling dark secrets from her past.

name: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
description: The first book in The Kingkiller Chronicle series, following the life and adventures of Kvothe, a gifted young man with a mysterious past.

name: Mistborn: The Final Empire
author: Brandon Sanderson
description: The first book in the Mistborn series, set in a world where a young street thief discovers her unique magical abilities and becomes involved in a revolution against an immortal ruler.

name: The Lies of Locke Lamora
author: Scott Lynch
description: The first book in the Gentleman Bastard series, featuring a group of skilled con artists and thieves navigating the criminal underworld of a fantastical city.

name: The Way of Kings
author: Brandon Sanderson
description: The first book in The Stormlight Archive series, set in a world torn by war and political intrigue, following characters with extraordinary abilities and destinies.

name: The Blade Itself
author: Joe Abercrombie
description: The first book in The First Law trilogy, featuring a diverse cast of characters caught up in a world of war, politics, and dark magic.

name: The Priory of the Orange Tree
author: Samantha Shannon
description: A standalone epic fantasy novel featuring dragon riders, mages, and a world threatened by an ancient dragon that awakens to wreak havoc.

name: The Notebook
author: Nicholas Sparks
description: A heartwarming love story between Noah Calhoun and Allie Nelson, spanning decades and overcoming challenges, inspired by the author's own grandparents' relationship.
details: ISBN: 978-0446605236, Pages: 214, Publisher: Grand Central Publishing

name: Outlander
author: Diana Gabaldon
description: A time-traveling romance novel following Claire Randall, a World War II nurse, who is transported to 18th-century Scotland, where she meets Jamie Fraser and becomes entangled in political intrigue and love.

name: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic romance novel revolving around the relationship between Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy, exploring themes of love, class, and societal expectations.

name: Me Before You
author: Jojo Moyes
description: A heartrending romance novel featuring Louisa Clark, a young woman who becomes a caregiver for a quadriplegic man, Will Traynor, and their emotional journey together.

name: The Rosie Project
author: Graeme Simsion
description: A quirky romantic comedy about Don Tillman, a genetics professor with social difficulties, who embarks on a project to find the perfect wife, leading to unexpected love.

name: The Wedding Date
author: Jasmine Guillory
description: A contemporary romance novel featuring Alexa Monroe, a successful lawyer, and Drew Nichols, a pediatric surgeon, who become each other's impromptu wedding dates and embark on a romantic journey.

name: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir recounting the author's journey from growing up in a strict and abusive household in rural Idaho, to self-education, and eventually earning a PhD from Cambridge University.

name: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: A memoir by the former First Lady of the United States, Michelle Obama, reflecting on her early life, marriage, motherhood, and experiences during her time in the White House.
details: ISBN: 978-1524763138, Pages: 448, Publisher: Crown Publishing Group

name: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A thought-provoking exploration of the history of Homo sapiens, from ancient ancestors to the present, covering significant events and developments that shaped human society.

name: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
author: Rebecca Skloot
description: A biography exploring the life of Henrietta Lacks, an African American woman whose cancer cells were unknowingly harvested for scientific research, leading to significant medical advancements.

name: In Cold Blood
author: Truman Capote
description: A true crime classic detailing the brutal murder of the Clutter family in 1959, exploring the investigation, trial, and the impact of the crime on the small town of Holcomb, Kansas.

name: Into the Wild
author: Jon Krakauer
description: A narrative non-fiction book chronicling the journey of Christopher McCandless, a young man who left his conventional life behind to embark on a solo adventure into the Alaskan wilderness.

name: Steve Jobs
author: Walter Isaacson
description: A biography of Apple co-founder Steve Jobs, exploring his life, career, and impact on the technology industry.

name: The Diary of a Young Girl
author: Anne Frank
description: The diary of Anne Frank, a Jewish girl hiding from the Nazis during World War II, providing a poignant and powerful account of her experiences.

name: Malcolm X: A Life of Reinvention
author: Manning Marable
description: A comprehensive biography of civil rights leader Malcolm X, offering new perspectives on his life, activism, and impact on American history.

name: The Wright Brothers
author: David McCullough
description: A biography of aviation pioneers Wilbur and Orville Wright, chronicling their journey to invent and build the world's first successful airplane.

name: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
author: Rebecca Skloot
description: A biography exploring the life of Henrietta Lacks, an African American woman whose cancer cells were unknowingly harvested for scientific research, leading to significant medical advancements.

name: Leonardo da Vinci
author: Walter Isaacson
description: A biography of the renowned Renaissance artist and inventor Leonardo da Vinci, exploring his genius, inventions, and artistic achievements.

name: A People's History of the United States
author: Howard Zinn
description: A groundbreaking historical account focusing on marginalized voices and social movements in the United States, offering a different perspective on American history.
details: ISBN: 978-0062397348, Pages: 777, Publisher: Harper Perennial Modern Classics

name: The Guns of August
author: Barbara W. Tuchman
description: A Pulitzer Prize-winning history book detailing the events leading up to World War I, examining the political and military decisions of the time.

name: The Wright Brothers
author: David McCullough
description: A detailed account of the lives and achievements of Wilbur and Orville Wright, pioneers of aviation and inventors of the world's first successful airplane.

name: The Rise and Fall of the Third Reich
author: William L. Shirer
description: A comprehensive history of Nazi Germany, covering the events leading to Hitler's rise to power, World War II, and the eventual fall of the Third Reich.

author: David McCullough
description: A historical narrative focusing on the events of the American Revolutionary War in 1776, providing insights into the challenges faced by the Continental Army.

name: The Warmth of Other Suns
author: Isabel Wilkerson
description: A narrative exploring the Great Migration of African Americans from the Southern United States to northern and western cities, spanning the years 1915 to 1970.

name: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
author: Stephen R. Covey
description: A transformative guide emphasizing principles for personal and professional effectiveness, focusing on character development, ethical decision making, and collaboration.

name: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: A practical guide to forming positive habits and eliminating harmful ones, using scientific insights and real-life examples to help readers create lasting change.

name: Grit
author: Angela Duckworth
description: An exploration of the role of perseverance and passion in achieving long-term goals, emphasizing the importance of grit in personal and professional success.

name: You Are a Badass
author: Jen Sincero
description: A motivational guide empowering readers to overcome self-doubt, embrace their potential, and create a life filled with confidence, purpose, and joy.

name: The Power of Now
author: Eckhart Tolle
description: A spiritual guide encouraging readers to embrace the present moment, alleviate anxiety, and achieve a state of inner peace and enlightenment.
details: ISBN: 978-1577314806, Pages: 236, Publisher: New World Library

name: Daring Greatly
author: Brené Brown
description: A transformative exploration of vulnerability and shame, inspiring readers to embrace vulnerability, cultivate courage, and live wholeheartedly in their relationships and endeavors.

name: The Joy of Cooking
author: Irma S. Rombauer
description: A timeless culinary classic providing a wide range of recipes, cooking techniques, and kitchen tips, catering to both novice and experienced home cooks.

name: Salt, Fat, Acid, Heat
author: Samin Nosrat
description: A culinary guide exploring the fundamental elements of cooking: salt, fat, acid, and heat, teaching readers how to balance flavors and create delicious dishes.

name: The Food Lab
author: J. Kenji López-Alt
description: A comprehensive cookbook combining scientific insights and practical cooking techniques, helping readers understand the science behind recipes for improved results.
details: ISBN: 978-0393081084, Pages: 960, Publisher: W. W. Norton & Company

name: Mastering the Art of French Cooking
author: Julia Child
description: A classic French cookbook offering detailed instructions and authentic recipes, making French cuisine accessible to home cooks and culinary enthusiasts.

name: Essentials of Classic Italian Cooking
author: Marcella Hazan
description: A definitive guide to Italian cooking, featuring traditional recipes, cooking techniques, and tips to create authentic Italian dishes at home.

name: The Pioneer Woman Cooks
author: Ree Drummond
description: A collection of recipes inspired by the author's life on a ranch, featuring hearty and comforting dishes, along with anecdotes and personal stories.
details: ISBN: 978-0061658198, Pages: 240, Publisher: William Morrow Cookbooks

name: Into the Wild
author: Jon Krakauer
description: A travel adventure book following the journey of Christopher McCandless, a young man who ventured into the Alaskan wilderness, exploring themes of self-discovery and survival.

name: In a Sunburned Country
author: Bill Bryson
description: A humorous travel memoir recounting the author's journey through Australia, exploring the country's landscapes, culture, and unique wildlife.

name: Eat, Pray, Love
author: Elizabeth Gilbert
description: A travel memoir documenting the author's year-long journey across Italy, India, and Indonesia, exploring the pursuit of pleasure, spirituality, and balance.

name: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel following the journey of Santiago, an Andalusian shepherd boy, as he travels across the desert in search of his personal legend and destiny.

name: Wild Swans
author: Jung Chang
description: A family biography spanning three generations of women in China, exploring their experiences through the turbulent events of the 20th century.

name: The Lost City of Z
author: David Grann
description: A true adventure story following the journey of British explorer Percy Fawcett, who disappeared in the Amazon rainforest while searching for an ancient civilization.
